content.description: Blocky climbing at first then into a thin corner where the crux is found.  It finishes on steep blocks and ledges to chain anchors.  A new bolt has been placed at the crux to better protect it since the first ascent.
content.location: Just right of a pine tree growing close to the cliff face.

content.description:
Starts on blocky but vertical 5.10sh terrain that leads to a prominent ramp about halfway up the route. Rest up and head out for the obvious sharp red arete. The arete is the 5.11 section of the climb so keep on moving and avoid the pump!

Note: It is possible to avoid the crux move at the bottom of the red arete by going left into the chimney/open book for a move or two before traversing out right to the arete. This variant drops the grade to perhaps an 11a.
content.protection: Around 10 bolts to the 2 bolt anchors.
content.location: To the immediate right of a prominent roof (with a bolted project running through it).

content.description: This is a climb with several variations. Pulgar del diablo has two starts a true 10D start with human yucca eating plant below it, and a high 1st bolt 5.9 start to the right of that. The 5.9 variation start only has one bolt before continuing back into the original route. The climb continues on up a moderate slab up to tricky bulge which leads into the devils thumb. top the thumb into a cruxy and fingery good time, before topping out to a two bolt anchor.
content.protection: 9 Bolts with two anchors.  High HIgh first bolt
content.location: Just right of the human eating yucca plant.

content.description: This is a climb with several variations.  Pulgar del diablo has two starts a true 10D start with human yucca eating plant below it, and a high 1st bolt 5.9 start to the right of that.  The 5.9 variation start only has one bolt before continuing back into the original route. The climb continues on up a moderate slab up to tricky bulge which leads into the devils thumb.  top the thumb into a cruxy and fingery good time, before topping out to a two bolt anchor.
content.protection:
12 bolts plus to anchors

Variation is only 9 bolts

content.description: Starts in a shallow gulley where the first three bolts are shared between Angelic Ecstasy to the left and Infernal Ecstasy to the right. Gain the ramp and head straight up the right side of the rounded arete. Work the flakes right of the bolt line, and look for good but awkward clipping stances here.
This also share the starts with Pulgar del Diablo but continues right and up to a double under clings.  pull the cruxy bulge and climb up to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: inbetween pulgar del diablo and bangarang

content.description: Climbs the same as bangarang until the crack the steers right and onto the face or climb the ramp with you're belayer to the ledge and go up some junky stuff to approach the roof. Cruise out the roof and follow the obvious crack line.
content.protection: I placed cams up to tight hands with doubles on fingers and small fingers. Bring more medium pro if you approach from the first part of bangarang.
content.location: Right of bangarang. Left of a bolted line.

content.description: Blocky start gets you up onto a ledge about 25 feet up. Continue up less than vertical face on smooth basalt with small incuts throughout the rock for hands and feet. Watch out for cactus 3/4 of the way up, shouldn't cause any problems though.
content.location: Left of pine tree that is right up against face. Left of Sawatdee

content.description: Starts off new some oak trees and follows a short s crack to a narrow dihedral.  Wonderfull hand crack!

Starts by following a large crack in an open book. A second smaller lay-back crack eventually gains one access to a ramp. From the ramp follow the bolts up the wavy and broken blackish arete. Save some courage for the final crux move just below the anchors.
content.protection: Trad gear for the bottom half of the route, bolts (and a 2 bolt top anchor) for the upper half of the route.
content.location: The route starts in an open book corner to the left of a roof. The top half follows an arete to the left of the very prominant red arete of Red Queen.

content.description:
Note! Â The route name is a placeholder to pair opposite its Infernal partner to the right. This was more fun than "Unknown," for now, and the actual route name correction is welcome.

This line shares the first three bolts with Infernal Ecstasy, then branches left. Above the ledge, pull a slight overhang through smooth red stone, then power up to the chains.
content.location: Starts in a shallow gulley where the first three bolts are shared between Angelic Ecstasy to the left and Infernal Ecstasy to the right. Identified at the base by a plaque.
